Description: Detected a Generic API Key, potentially exposing access to various services and sensitive operations.
Author: stark
Message:
feat: Add output guardrails for post-execution response validation

Add OutputGuard pipeline that validates LLM responses before returning
to the caller. Mirrors the input Guard pattern with fail-close policy.

- OutputGuardStage interface with Allowed/Modified/Rejected results
- PiiMaskingOutputGuard: masks Korean RRN, phone, credit card, email
- RegexPatternOutputGuard: configurable patterns with MASK/REJECT actions
- OUTPUT_GUARD_REJECTED error code + recordOutputGuardAction() metric
- Opt-in via arc.reactor.output-guard.enabled=true (default OFF)
- Integrated in SpringAiAgentExecutor.finishExecution() before ResponseFilter
- 43 new tests (pipeline, PII masking, regex patterns, executor integration)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>

Description: Detected a Generic API Key, potentially exposing access to various services and sensitive operations.
Author: Stark
Message:
test: Add arc-slack comprehensive tests (24 new, 53 total)

- DefaultSlackEventHandlerTest: mention stripping, session ID, response handling
- SlackSignatureWebFilterTest: path filtering, signature verification, body replay
- SlackEventControllerConcurrencyTest: semaphore limiting, error isolation
- Add reactor-test dependency for WebFilter StepVerifier tests

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>

Description: Detected a Generic API Key, potentially exposing access to various services and sensitive operations.
Author: Stark
Message:
feat: Convert to multi-module + add arc-slack integration

- Convert to Gradle multi-module: arc-core (existing code) + arc-slack (new)
- arc-slack: Slack gateway module with WebFlux WebFilter signature verification,
  async event processing (3s Slack constraint), and AgentExecutor integration
- 9 source files + 4 test files for arc-slack, all passing
- arc-core: 890 tests still passing after migration
- Updated Dockerfile, CLAUDE.md for multi-module structure

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
